intro: Pouteria tenuisepala, commonly known as the narrow-lobed spondias, is a species of flowering plant in the family Sapotaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are elliptic to ovate in shape. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are clustered in panicles, and it produces edible, round fruits with a sweet, starchy pulp. Pouteria tenuisepala is often found in lowland rainforests and is adapted to humid, warm climates.
